column10: Canada

Migration Data Explorer: Explore the migration of people across the world.

column10: xSlug

column3: The total number of people living in a given country that were born in another country. This measures the cumulative migrant stock.

Migration Data Explorer: Share of the population that are international migrants
column3: The share of a country's population that were born in another country.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of international migrants in the previous five years
column3: The change in the total number of migrants living in a given country compared to five years ago. A positive number indicates there are now more migrants living in a given country; a negative number means there are fewer.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of international migrants per capita in the previous five years
column3: The change in the total number of migrants living in a given country compared to five years ago. A positive number indicates there are now more migrants living in a given country; a negative number means there are fewer.
Total number of people that have left the country.

Migration Data Explorer: Total number of emigrants per capita
column3: The total number of people that have left the country, as a share of the current population.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of emigrants in the previous five years
column3: The total number of people born in that country that are now living in another country, compared to five years ago. A positive number indicates there are now more emigrants living in a given country; a negative number means there are fewer.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of emigrants per capita in the previous five years
column3: The total number of people born in that country that are now living in another country, compared to five years ago. A positive number indicates there are now more emigrants living in a given country; a negative number means there are fewer.

Net migration is the total the number of migrants (people moving into a given country) minus the number of emigrants (people moving out of the country). This is a measure of migrant stock; it does not indicate the net flow per year.

Net migration is the total the number of migrants (people moving into a given country) minus the number of emigrants (people moving out of the country). This is a measure of migrant stock; it does not indicate the net flow per year. This is expressed per 1000 people in the domestic population.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of child migrant arrivals per capita
Number of child migrant arrivals per capita
Inflow of family migrants per capita
Inflow of migrant workers per capita
Number of refugees living in the host country
column3: Total number of refugees living in the host country. This measures the total number of refugees living in the country; not the number of arrivals per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of refugees living in the host country per 100,000 people
column3: Total number of refugees living in the host country, measured per 100,000 people. This measures the total number of refugees living in the country; not the number of arrivals per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of refugees from the country of origin
column3: Total number of refugees by country of origin. This measures the total number of refugees from the country; not the number per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of refugees from the country of origin per 100,000 people
column3: Total number of refugees by country of origin, measured per 100,000 people. This measures the total number of refugees from the country; not the number per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of pending asylum applications by destination country
column3: The total number of people in the country whose application for asylum or refugee status is pending at any stage in the asylum procedure.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of pending asylum applications per capita by destination country
column3: The number of people in the country whose application for asylum or refugee status is pending at any stage in the asylum procedure, expressed per 100,000 people in the host country.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of pending asylum applications by origin country
column3: The total number of people from a given country who has a pending application for asylum or refugee status in any other country.

Migration Data Explorer: Number of pending asylum applications per capita by origin country
column3: The number of people from a given country who has a pending application for asylum or refugee status in any other country, expressed per 100,000 people in the origin country.
The number of refugees that were resettled in the country per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Resettled refugees per capita, by destination
column3: The number of refugees that were resettled in the country per year. This is measured per 100,000 people in the host country.
The number of refugees from the country that were resettled in another country per year.

Migration Data Explorer: Resettled refugees per capita, by origin
column3: The number of refugees from the country that were resettled in another country per year. This is measured per 100,000 people of the origin country.

Migration Data Explorer: Internal displacement due to conflict per year
Share of the population internally displaced due to conflict per year
Internal displacement due to disasters per year
Share of the population internally displaced due to disasters per year
Share of the population internally displaced due to conflict
Share of the population internally displaced due to disasters
Remittances as a share of GDP
column3: Remittances are in-kind cash transfers made from individuals in a given country to households outside of the host country.

Migration Data Explorer: Remittance costs as a share of remittances based on the host country
column3: Remittances are in-kind cash transfers made from individuals in a given country to households outside of the host country.

Migration Data Explorer: Remittance costs as a share of remittances based on the receiving country
column3: Remittances are in-kind cash transfers made from individuals in a given country to households outside of the host country.
